result.execSummary:
The defendant David C Allender was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
Drug buy money to be repaid within 15 months.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

AODA evaluation and followthrough.
Absolute sobriety.
No controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Full time employment or 10 job searches per month, except while incarcerated.
Any counseling recommended.
No contact with T.R.

records.addlTxt: Letter from SPD office informing us that defendant does not wish to pursue an appeal; therefore, SPD is canceling the request for the court record and preparation of transcripts.

Defendant David C Allender in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Haacke - previously filed documents w/court to support motions.  DA Parker cites 809.31, offers Exhibits 1-3.  Atty Haacke - rebuttle. Court - no substantial risk, no unsettled area of law, DENIES Motion to Stay.

Defendant David C Allender in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Greg Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire submitted.  No contest to Counts 1 & 2.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Count 3 DRI.  Citizenship, voting, and/or firearms information provided.  Arguments as to penalty.  Exhibits #1 & 2 offered by State.  Letter from defendant's Pastor received.  Court withholds sentence, 2 years probation with conditions.  Appeal rights.  No expungment allowed.
Plea hearing on November 9, 2016 at 09:00 am.
